meanings.definition: Loyal, constant, and steadfast in affection or allegiance
meanings.sent1: She is a faithful friend who always stands by your side.
meanings.sent2: The dog was faithful to its owner, never leaving their side.
meanings.sent3: The faithful pet greeted its owner with a wagging tail every day.
meanings.sent4: Her faithful dedication to her work shone through in every task she completed.
meanings.sent5: The faithful soldier never wavered in his commitment to protect his country.

meanings.sent1: The old watch may not be fancy, but it is faithful and always keeps time.
meanings.sent2: A faithful assistant can make all the difference in a busy office.
meanings.sent3: The faithful alarm clock never failed to wake him up, even on Mondays.
meanings.sent4: Her faithful guidance led the team to success time and time again.
meanings.sent5: A faithful companion is someone you can always rely on in times of need.

meanings.definition: Consistent with truth or fact; accurate
meanings.sent1: The faithful account of the events matched the eyewitness reports.
meanings.sent2: A faithful reproduction of the painting captured every detail perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The faithful weather forecast helped them plan a picnic without any surprises.
meanings.sent4: His faithful memory of the conversation allowed him to recall every detail accurately.
meanings.sent5: The faithful map guided them through the forest with precision and accuracy.
